item.title: Dynamic programming for general models
item.description: Consider a general controlled input output system with two inputs—control action \(U_t\) and disturbance \(W_t\)—and two outputs—observation \(Y_t\) and cost \(C_t\). We assume that the system has an initial state, which we denote by \(X_1\), and assume to be random. We do not assume a state-space model for the system, but simply assume an input-ouput model, i.e., there exist functions \(\{f_t\}_{t \ge 1}\) and \(\{h_t\}_{t \ge 1}\) such that1 \[ Y_t = f_t(X_1, U_{1:t-1}, W_{1:t-1}) \](1) and \[ C_t = h_t(X_1, U_{1:t}, W_{1:t-1}).
